intro: Kefersteinia alba, commonly known as the white kefersteinia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval or lance-shaped with a smooth margin. Native to regions of Central Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
